v8:item.v8:content: Some of the additional data processors are running. Wait till they finish before starting the update. <link Ref>View update result</>

When updating to a new patch release (that is, the 4th version number has changed), you can continue the update while additional data processors are running.
For other releases (1st, 2d, or 3d version number has changed), we recommend waiting until additional data processors are finished. Otherwise, you might lose some data as such releases could update the datasets.
If a data processor fails, contact technical support and after fixing the error, restart the update.
Data integrity issues have been identified in the application. It is recommended that you resolve them before the update. <link View the report>View the report</>

One of the common reasons for critical errors to occur during updates is data integrity issues, such as references to non-existing objects and empty required attributes. In this case, we recommend that you fix the issues before the update. To do so, open the report and follow the recommendations that it provides.

Before updating, make sure that the installed extensions are compatible with the new configuration version. It is recommended that you test the update on a backup. <link Go to the list of extensions>View extensions</>
Data integrity has not been checked for a while. It is recommended that you <link PereitiKSpiskuProverok>run system checks</> before the update.

One of the common reasons for critical errors to occur during updates is data integrity issues, such as references to non-existing objects and empty required attributes. In this case, we recommend that you fix the issues before the update.
Update file is not required as it is already imported into the main configuration
Specify an update or patch file:
The main configuration differs from the database configuration. It is recommended that you perform an update from the main configuration.
Update is not required as the infobase configuration is identical to the main configuration.
Install the update now (requires restarting the application)
Remind me when I exit the application
The update might take a long time. Do not turn off your computer until the update is completed.
Update received from application file page
The update is received from the online application. To install it restart the application. The update might take a long time. Do not turn off your computer until the update is completed.
Other users are currently working with the application. Close their sessions to update the application.
View the list of active users
External applications are currently working with the application. Close them to update the application.
View the list of active connections
Designer is running. Please close Designer to update the application.
View the list of active users
Create a temporary infobase backup and roll back if any issues occur
Install the update now (requires restarting the application)
Remind me when I exit the application
The update will be installed from this computer in background. Ensure that the computer will be turned on at the scheduled time.
Notify users <link Ref>5 minutes</> before update
The update might take a long time. Do not turn off your computer until the update is completed.
Other users are working with the application. Their sessions will be terminated automatically.
View the list of active users
Other users and external applications are connected to the infobase. Their sessions will be terminated automatically.
View the list of active connections
It is recommended that you back up the infobase before installing an update.
An error occurred during the patch installation. See the <link EventLog>event log</> for details.
Patches installed: %1 out of %2. The changes will be applied after you restart the application.
The patches are installed. They will be applied after you restart the application.
<link 1>Other users</> are working with the application. They will see the patches applied the next time they log in.
The application is updated every time it synchronizes its data with "%1."
